questionText: Why does IOTA allow transferring objects directly to other objects?

answerOptions.answerText: Because object IDs and addresses are both 32-byte IDs and do not overlap.
Because objects can be converted to addresses using a special function.
Because IOTA only supports object-to-object transfers.

questionText: What must be ensured when transferring an object to another object in IOTA?

answerOptions.answerText: The recipient object has the `drop` ability.
The recipient object exists and is not immutable.
The recipient object is owned by the same address.
The recipient object is of the same type as the sender.

questionText: What does the `Receiving<T>` struct represent in IOTA's transfer mechanism?

answerOptions.answerText: It represents the ability to receive an object of type `T`.
It is used to send objects to addresses.
It allows objects to be transferred without verification.
It provides storage capabilities for received objects.
